snippet: Shareda Waldron, despite steady employment, landed in a homeless shelter with her young son until a housing agency stepped in.
abstract: Shareda Waldron and her son Trae Colvil receive help from SemiPerm housing agency to move into apartment on Upper West Side of Manhattan from homeless shelter; SemiPerm is partner with Community Service Society of New York, one of agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
lead_paragraph: Shareda Waldron, despite steady employment, landed in a homeless shelter with her young son until a housing agency stepped in.

headline.print_headline: Out of a Shelter, a Mother Studies to Be a Paramedic
headline.main: Out of a Shelter, a Single Mother Studies to Be a Paramedic
